internal.content:
--- title: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo description: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Predictive decisioning
300-level live demo ); ![Predictive decisioning banner](./images/Predictive-Decisioning-300-Prep-GitHub-banner-12-15-21.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation integrates machine learning to improve decisions. To illustrate this, a company’s customer retention offer process is automated. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation, Cloud Pak for Data (Machine learning capabilities) | | **Demo capabilities** | Decision management; Predictive analytics | | **Sales guidance** | Download the sales guidance document here. | | **Demo intro slides** | Download the Introduction and Overview slides here. This is a short deck of customer-facing slides that sets the context for the demo. | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here.

This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and screenshots of what you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Demo downloads** | • SkyTalk’s Retention offer document.pdf
• SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv
• SkyTalk customer value data.csv
• SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_V12.twx
• SkyTalk-customer-retention-DS_21.0.2_V12.zip | | **Sales enablement video** | View the enablement video here. This video is for enablement purposes only (IBMers and Business Partners) and is not customer-ready. | | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.2, Cloud Pak for Data 4.0

If you are using **Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.3**, follow the instructions [here](/300-business-automation-predictive-decisioning/v21.0.3). | | **How to get support** | **For IBMers:**
• Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo.

**For Business Partners:**
• Contact Tech Zone Support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact Automation Platinum Demos Support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **INSTALL THE DEMO**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
Install Cloud Pak for Business Automation 21.0.2, or provision a ROKS environment. To reserve your ROKS instance, follow these steps:

1. To reserve a preinstalled Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA) V21.0.2 on Red Hat OpenShift, go here and complete the form. (If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** to create a two-week reservation.)
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.

3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact TechZone support or refer to the installation documentation here.


4. Once you receive this email, it may take up to eight hours for the system to fully install Cloud Pak for Business Automation. To access your ROKS environment, click the Cluster URL from the email you have received.
Your cluster is installed when you are able to find the icp4adeploy-cp4ba-accesss-info file in substep 8 of this section.

If it does not appear after eight hours please refer to the ROKS help or contact the TechZone support: techzone.help@ibm.com.
5. Ensure there are no **Alerts** for the cluster.

6. Click the **OpenShift web console** blue button on the top right corner of the screen.

7. Expand **Workloads** (1) and click **ConfigMaps** (2).

8. Search for **access** (1) in the search area. Click the **icp4deploy-cp4ba-access-info** (2) file.

9. Scroll down to the **bastudio-access-info** section. This section contains your login information for Cloud Pak for Business Automation. Create a browser bookmark for the Cloud Pak for Business Automation using the **Cloudpak Dashboard URL** (1). Go to the other **three URLs and accept the self-signed certificates** (2). Keep a copy of the **username** and **password** (3) to log in to the Cloud Pak Dashboard.


10. Scroll down to the **gitea-access-info** section. Copy and save these credentials, which you will use later during Automation Decision Services (ADS) setup.


11. Connect to your gitea environment using the URL and credentials provided. Click through the privacy messages and click **Sign In**.

12. Enter the same **Username** and **Password** (1) provided in the **gitea-access-info** file and click **Sign in** (2).

13. Click **+** to create the git repository.

14. Name the repository **SkyTalk_customer_retention** (1). Click **Create Repository** (2).
Ensure there are no spaces in the name.

15. Keep a copy of the repository URL, which is required later to configure ADS.


**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Create and set up a Watson Studio account
The Watson Machine Learning (WML) free account uses a charge unit called CUHs (Capacity Unit Hours) and provides 20 free CUHs per month. In general, each hour your models are deployed uses two CUHs. Once models are deployed, the CUHs are consumed at this rate until the models are undeployed. Therefore, you MUST UNDEPLOY the models in a timely manner. Assuming you undeploy the model after each demo, the free account will enable you to run a one-hour demo seven times in a month.

See the INSTRUCTIONS FOR UNDEPLOYING THE MACHINE LEARNING SERVICE section below.
1. Go to IBM Cloud.

2. Enter your **IBM ID**. If you do not have one, create a new one.

3. Ensure you are in your own Cloud Pak for Data account instance (1). Click **Create resource** (2).

4. Type **Watson** (1) in the search field and select **Watson Studio** (2).

5. Click the **Lite** plan (1). Select any **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

6. Return to **IBM Cloud**.

7. Click **Create resource**.


8. Type **Machine** (1) and select **Machine Learning** (2).

9. Click the **Lite** plan (1). Select any **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

10. Return to **IBM Cloud**.

11. Click **Create resource**.

12. Type **Object** (1) and select **Object Storage** (2).

13. Click the **Lite** plan (1), and click **Create** (2).

14. Click the **top menu** (1) and then **Resource list** (2).

15. Click **Services and software** (1) and click **Watson-Studio-xx** (2).

16. Click **Launch in IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.

17. Click **New deployment space**.

18. Name the production space **“SkyTalk production space”** (1). Set Cloud the storage service to **Cloud Object Storage-xx** (2). Select your newly created machine learning services, called **Machine Learning-xx** (3). Click **Create** (4).


19. Click **Close**.


20. Click **IBM Cloud Pak for Data** at the top left-hand side of the page to return to the home page.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Create and deploy two machine learning models
At this stage, the Watson Studio environment is completely set up. The three services (Watson Studio, ML, and Storage) are ready, and the deployment environment is set up. Now let’s create the two prediction services using AutoAI in Watson Studio.
Ensure you have downloaded these two data files prior to starting this step.

SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv
SkyTalk customer value data.csv

1. Click **New project** from the Watson Studio home page.

2. Select **Create an empty project**.

3. Name the project **SkyTalk customer retention** (1) and click **Create** (2).


4. Click **Assets**.


5. Click **New asset**.

6. Select **AutoAI**.

7. Name the AutoAI experiment **SkyTalk churn prediction** (1) and click **Associate a Machine Learning service instance** (2).

8. Select the **Machine learning** instance provisioned in the previous step (1). Click **Associate service** (2) in the blue ribbon.

9. Click **Reload**.

10. Click **Create**.

11. Click **Browse**.

12. Select the **SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv** file (1) and click **Open** (2).

13. Select **No** in the **Create a time series forecast?** field.

14. Select **Churn** in the **What do you want to predict?** field.

15. Click **Run experiment**.

16. Watson Studio will create 8 pipelines, which take approximately 2 minutes. An **Experiment completed** message (1) will display when the pipeline creation is finished. On the pipeline leaderboard, find the pipeline with a star icon (2) and save it as a model clicking **Save as** (3).

17. Select **Model** (1) and click **Create** (2).

18. A confirmation message appears, indicating the model was saved successfully (1). Return to the project view by clicking **SkyTalk customer retention** (2) in the breadcrumb navigation.

19. Create another AutoAI Experiment for the Customer lifetime value prediction. Click **New asset**.

20. Select **AutoAI**.

21. Name the AutoAI experiment **SkyTalk lifetime value prediction** (1) and click **Create** (2).
When you created the SkyTalk Churn value prediction you already defined the configuration. The Watson Machine Learning Service Instance is automatically populated.

22. Click **Browse**.

23. Select the **SkyTalk customer value data.csv** (1) file and then click **Open** (2).

24. When prompted **Create a time series forecast?**, click **No**.

25. Select **LifetimeValue** in the **What do you want to predict?** field.

26. Click **Run experiment**.

27. Watson Studio will create 8 pipelines, which take approximately 2 minutes. An **Experiment completed** message (1) will display when the pipeline creation is finished. On the pipeline leaderboard, find the pipeline with a star icon (2) and save it as a model clicking **Save as** (3).

28. Select **Model** (1) and click **Create** (2).

29. A confirmation message appears, indicating the model was saved successfully (1). Return to the project view by clicking **SkyTalk customer retention** (2) in the breadcrumb navigation.

30. Now there are two models ready to be promoted to the deployment space.

31. Hover the mouse over the **lifetime value prediction** model. Click on the three dots on the right-hand side and click **Promote to space**.

32. Choose the **SkyTalk production space** (1) as the target space and click **Promote** (2).

33. Promote the **SkyTalk churn prediction model** by repeating steps 31 - 32.

34. Click **IBM Cloud Pak for Data** to return to the home page.

35. Now you will deploy the models. Click **SkyTalk production space** in the Deployments section.
As a reminder, anytime your ML services are deployed your ML Lite subscription quota is consumed.

36. Select the **Assets** tab.

37. Select the top row and hover the cursor over the right side of the row until a rocket icon appears. Click the icon to **Deploy** the **SkyTalk churn prediction**.

38. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **churn** (2), and click **Create** (3).

39. Select the second row and hover the cursor over the right side of the row until a rocket icon appears. Click the icon to **Deploy** the **SkyTalk lifetime value prediction**.

40. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **Lifetime value** (2), and click **Create** (3).

41. Click the **Deployments** tab. Ensure the two services are deployed.

**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Get the credentials to set up the ML provider
This section explains how to get the credentials to set up the machine learning provider in ADS.
1. From the SkyTalk production space, select the **Deployments** tab (1) and click **churn** (2).

2. Copy the first portion of the **endpoint URL** path (the blue hightlighted section in the screenshot) and save it for the upcoming ML provider configuration.

3. Click **SkyTalk production space** in the breadcrumb navigation.

4. Select the **Manage** tab.

5. Copy the deployment **Space GUID** and save it for the upcoming ML provider configuration step.

6. Log out of **Watson Studio**.

7. Go to the **IBM Cloud environment** and log in using your personal credentials. Ensure you are in your Cloud Pak for Data instance (1).

Click the **Manage** (2) tab and select **Access (IAM)** (3).

8. Click **API keys** (1) and then click **Create an IBM Cloud API key** (2).

9. Name the key **MY_API_Key** (1) and click **Create** (2).

10. Copy and save the API key. Download the **API key file** and save it for the upcoming ML provider configuration step.

**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Open Automation Decision Services (ADS) and import the ADS demo project
Prior to performing this step, make sure you have downloaded the file: SkyTalk-customer-retention-DS_21.0.2_V12.zip. This file is required to set-up the ADS decision service.
1. Log in to your Cloud Pak for Business Automation instance. (Use the bookmark you created and the credentials you saved in step 9 of section **1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment**.)
If prompted for an authentication method, select Enterprise LDAP.
2. Expand the **top menu** (1) and click **Design** (2). Click **Business Automations** (3).

3. Pass through the privacy warning messages.

4. Under **Business automations**, click **Create** (1) and select **Decision automations** (2).

5. Name the automation **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (1) and click **Create**. (2)

6. Accept any privacy checks that may appear.

7. Close any guided tour views.

8. Click **Import**.

9. Select the SkyTalk-customer-retention-DS_21.0.2_V12.zip file and click **Open**.

10. Click **Import**.

11. Configure the ADS environment by clicking on the three dots to the right of the **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (1) and click **Settings** (2).

12. In the **Remote Git repositories** tab, paste the git **Repository URL** (1) from step 1.15. Enter the git **username and password** (2) from the ROKS access file in step 1.10. Click **Connect** (3).
To perform the following steps, your two machine learning services must be deployed in the Watson Studio deployment environment.

13. Ensure the **Remote Git repository** status is **Connected**.

14. Click the **Machine learning providers** tab to configure the machine learning provider.

15. Click **New**.

16. Select the **Watson ML** (1) machine provider and name the ML provider **SkyTalk ML provider** (2). Enter the **API key** (3), **Space ID** (4), and **URL** (5) from step 4 and click **Test connection** (6).

17. If the connection is successful, click **Save**.

18. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

**[Go to top](#top)**
6 - Update the decision model with the deployed ML models
Before performing this step, make sure your 2 ML services are deployed as explained in step 3.35.
1. Click the **SkyTalk retention DS** tile.

2. Click the **Customer Churn** model on the models tab.

3. Click **Connect**.

4. Select **SkyTalk ML provider**.

5. Expand the **SkyTalk churn prediction model** (1), select the **churn** deployment (2), and click **Next** (3).

6. Click **Next**.

7. Click **Run** to test the invocation.

8. If the test succeeds, click **Next**.

9. Click **Generate from test output**.

10. Click **OK**.

11. Click **Apply**.

12. Return to the **SkyTalk retention DS** using the breadcrumb navigation.

13. Click **Customer lifetime value** and repeat operations 6.3 - 6.12, expanding and selecting the **Customer lifetime value ML** model. After you have connected the the **Customer lifetime value** model, proceed to the next step (step 6.14).

14. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (1) in the breadcrumb navigation and click the **Retention Offer** model (2).

15. Select the **Run** tab.

16. Select the **High value profile** test file (1) and click **Run** (2).

The **retention offer** should display (3). Click **Run** again if you get a timeout error the first time.

**[Go to top](#top)**
7 - Deploy the decision service
Make sure you deploy the Skytalk retention DS decision service and not the SkyTalk initial retention DS.
1. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

2. Select the **Share changes** tab.

3. Ensure all changes are selected (1) and click **Share** (2).

4. Click **Share** to push the updates to the Git repository.

5. Select the **View history** tab.

6. Click **Version +** in the most recent **Last shared** history.

7. Name this version **V1** (1) and click **Create** (2).

8. Click the **Deploy** tab.

9. Expand the last created version **(V1)** (1) and click **Deploy** (2) in the **SkyTalk retention DS** row.

10. Click **Deploy** to confirm.

11. Wait for the deployment to finish. Click **Business Automations** in the breadcrumb navigation.

12. **Click Decision** (1) then click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (2).

13. Publish the version you just deployed by clicking on the three dots on the right hand side of the V1 row, then click **Publish**.

14. Click **Publish**.

15. Ensure the status is **Published**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
8 - Import the client application
Prior to performing this step, make sure you have downloaded the SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_V12.twx archive file. This file is required to set-up the ADS decision service.
1. Expand the **top menu** (1) and click **Design** (2). Click **Business applications** (3).

2. Click **Import**.

3. Click **Browse**.

4. Select the SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_V12.twx file and click **Open**.


5. Click **OK**.

6. After the import, hover the mouse over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

7. Click the **gear icon**.

8. Select the **Advanced view mode** (1) and click **Save** (2).

9. Refresh the page and ensure the Advanced, **Diagram** and **Variables**, menus are accessible.

**[Go to top](#top)**
9 - Reconnect the application to the decision service
This step must be performed anytime a new version of the SkyTalk_rentention_DS is deployed. Ensure only the latest deployed DS is published to prevent Data renaming issues when reimporting the new service.
1. Click the **Diagram** tab.

2. Click the **SkyTalk_rentention_ds** node (1), then click the **Implementation** tab (2).

3. Click **New...**

4. Select **skytalk_retention_ds**.

5. Click **Add**.

6. Click **x** to close the view that appears.

7. Make sure operation is set to **retentionOffer** (1). Then select the **Data Mapping** tab (2).

8. Ensure there are no errors in the **data mapping section** (1). Click the **Preview** (2) to test the application.

9. Accept the security checks and enlarge the panel to see the entire view.

10. Enter **Peter Carter** (1) and click **Search** (2).

11. Click **Get offer**.

12. The offer displays.

The demo is ready.

When you are not practicing or delivering the demo, it is imperative that you reset the demo and save your ML quota in Watson Studio by following the steps in the AFTER EACH DEMO section below. Otherwise, your quota will be consumed quickly, which could prevent you from delivering any new demos until the end of the month.
**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO**
Open these resources before starting the demonstration
1. Log in to **Cloud Pak for Business Automation**. Use the bookmark and credentials saved during environment initialization. (See step 13 of *section 1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment*.)
2. Open the **top menu** (1), select the arrow in the **Design** row, (2), and click **Business applications** (3).

3. Hover the mouse over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

4. Click the **Preview** to open the application.


5. The **SkyTalk call center Application** opens.


**2 - IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation**
1. Return to the Cloud Pak for Business Automation home page.

Open the **top menu** (1) and select **Home** (2).


2. The **Cloud Pak for Business Automation** home page opens.


**3 - Watson Studio**
1. Go to the IBM Cloud environment and log in using your personal credentials. Ensure you are in your Cloud Pak for Data instance.
Click the resource list icon and then select **Watson Studio-xx** (2).


2. Click on **Launch** in **IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.


3. **Watson Studio** opens.


**4 - SkyTalk customer retention policy.pdf**
1. Click to open SkyTalk customer retention policy.pdf.
**[Go to top](#top)**
## **INSTRUCTIONS FOR UNDEPLOYING THE MACHINE LEARNING SERVICE** As a reminder, anytime your ML services are deployed your ML Lite subscription quota is consumed.
Undeploy the Watson Machine Learning service
At the end of the demonstration, undeploy the two ML services.
1. Undeploy the two ML services from the deployment space (select the **SkyTalk production space**).

2. Click the **Deployments** tab (1). In the **Lifetime value** row, click the three dots in the right-hand side and select **Delete** (2).

Click **Delete** again to confirm the deletion. Repeat step 2 to delete the deployment for the **churn prediction** row.
As soon as the two services are deleted, your ML Lite subscription quota is not consumed anymore.

3. Click **Watson Studio** to return to the Watson Studio home page.

4. Click the **SkyTalk customer retention** project.

5. Click the **Assets** tab.

6. Click the three dots on the right-hand side of the **Churn prediction 2** AutoAI experiment.

7. Click **Remove**.

8. Click **Remove** again to confirm the removal.

9. Go to the **Cloud Pak for Automation** browser tab you previously opened. Click **Skywalk customer retention DS**.

10. Click **Open**.

11. Select the **SkyTalk initial retention DS** tile.

12. Click **Retention offer**.

13. Hover the mouse over the purple **Customer Churn** rounded box.

14. Click the trash icon to remove the node.

15. Click **SkyTalk initial retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

16. Click on the trash can icon that appears when you move your cursor to the right-hand side of the **Customer Churn** predictive model row.

**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARATION REQUIRED TO GIVE THIS DEMO AGAIN**
1 - Redeploy both ML models in Watson Studio
1. Go to the **IBM Cloud environment** and log in using your personal credentials. Ensure you are in your **Cloud Pak for Data instance**.
2. Enter your **IBM ID**. If you do not have one, create a new one.
3. Click the **top menu** (1) and then **Resource list** (2).


4. Click **Watson Studio-XX** in the **Software and services** section.


5. Click **Launch in IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.


6. From the Watson Studio environment, select the **SkyTalk production space** deployment.


7. Select the **Assets** tab.


8. Hover your cursor over the right hand side of the **Skytalk churn prediction** row. Click the **rocket icon** that displays and then click **Deploy**.


9. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **churn** (2), and click **Create** (3).


10. Hover your cursor over the right hand side of the **Skytalk lifetime value prediction** row. Click the **rocket icon** that displays and then click **Deploy**.


11. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **Lifetime value** (2), and click **Create** (3).


12. Click the **Deployments** tab. Ensure the status column indicates the two services are deployed.


**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Reconnect both ML models to Automation Decision Services
1. Log in to **Cloud Pak for Business Automation**. Use the bookmark and credentials saved during environment initialization. (Refer to substep 13 of step **1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment** above.)
2. Click the Recent automation **Skytalk customer retention DS**.


3. Click **Open**.


4. Click on the **SkyTalk retention DS** tile.


5. On the **Models** tab, click the **Customer Churn** model.


6. Click **Edit Configuration**.


7. Expand the **SkyTalk churn prediction** model.


8. Select the **churn** deployment (1), and click **Next** (2).


9. Click **Next**.


10. Click **Run** to test the invocation.


11. If the test succeeds, click **Next**.


12. Click **Generate from test output**.


13. Click **OK**.


14. Click **Apply**.


15. Return to the **SkyTalk retention DS** using the breadcrumb navigation.


16. Click **Customer lifetime value** and then repeat previous operations 2 - 14, expanding and selecting the Customer lifetime value ML model.


**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Redeploy the decision service
1. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

2. Select the **Share changes** tab.

3. Click the box next to **Decision service name** (1) to select all. Click **Share** (2).

4. Click **Share** to push the updates to the Git repository.

5. Select the **View history** tab.

6. Refresh the page. Click **Version +** in the most recent shared history.

7. Click **Version +** in the row with the deployment you just created.

8. **Name** the new version (1). For example, if the last version on the deployment list is V2, then name this deployment V3. Click **Create** (2).

9. Click the **Deploy** tab.

10. Expand the last shared version. This is the version you just created and named.

11. Select **Deploy** in the SkyTalk retention DS row.

12. Click **Deploy** when prompted.

13. Wait for the deployment to finish. Click **Business Automations**.

14. Click **Publish**.

15. Ensure the **Status** appears as **Published**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Reconnect the decision services to the call center application
This step must be performed anytime a new version of the SkyTalk_rentention_DS is deployed. Make sure only the latest deployed DS is published to prevent Data renaming issues when reimporting the new service.
1. Log in to **Cloud Pak for Business Automation**. Use the bookmark and credentials saved during environment initialization. (See step 9 of *section 1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment*.)
2. Click to open the **top menu** next to **IBM Cloud Pak** (1). Select the arrow next to **Design** (2) to expand the section. Click **Business applications** (3).

3. Hover the cursor over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

4. Click the **Diagram** tab.

5. Click the **Call SkyTalk_rentention_ds** node (1). Click the **Implementation** tab (2).

6. Click **New...**

7. Select **skytalk_retention_ds**.

8. Click **Add**.

9. Click **X** to close the view that appears.

10. Make sure operation is set to **retentionOffer** (1). Select the **Data Mapping** tab (2).

11. Ensure there are no errors in the **data mapping section** (1). Click **Preview** (2) to test the application.

12. Accept the security checks and enlarge the panel to see the entire view.

13. Enter **Peter Carter** (1). Click **Search** (2).

14. Click **Get offer**.

15. Ensure the offer displays.

**[Go to top](#top)**
*** Click [here](/300-business-automation-predictive-decisioning/demo-script) to go to the **Demo script** on the next tab.

MdxNode.rawBody:
--- title: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo description: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Predictive decisioning

To illustrate this, a company’s customer retention offer process is automated. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation, Cloud Pak for Data (Machine learning capabilities) | | **Demo capabilities** | Decision management; Predictive analytics | | **Sales guidance** | Download the sales guidance document here. | | **Demo intro slides** | Download the Introduction and Overview slides here. This is a short deck of customer-facing slides that sets the context for the demo. | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here.

This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and screenshots of what you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Demo downloads** | • SkyTalk’s Retention offer document.pdf
• SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv
• SkyTalk customer value data.csv
• SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_V12.twx
• SkyTalk-customer-retention-DS_21.0.2_V12.zip | | **Sales enablement video** | View the enablement video here. This video is for enablement purposes only (IBMers and Business Partners) and is not customer-ready. | | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.2, Cloud Pak for Data 4.0

If you are using **Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.3**, follow the instructions [here](/300-business-automation-predictive-decisioning/v21.0.3). | | **How to get support** | **For IBMers:**
• Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo.

**For Business Partners:**
• Contact Tech Zone Support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact Automation Platinum Demos Support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **INSTALL THE DEMO**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
Install Cloud Pak for Business Automation 21.0.2, or provision a ROKS environment. To reserve your ROKS instance, follow these steps:

1. To reserve a preinstalled Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA) V21.0.2 on Red Hat OpenShift, go here and complete the form. (If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** to create a two-week reservation.)
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.

3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact TechZone support or refer to the installation documentation here.


4. Once you receive this email, it may take up to eight hours for the system to fully install Cloud Pak for Business Automation. To access your ROKS environment, click the Cluster URL from the email you have received.
Your cluster is installed when you are able to find the icp4adeploy-cp4ba-accesss-info file in substep 8 of this section.

If it does not appear after eight hours please refer to the ROKS help or contact the TechZone support: techzone.help@ibm.com.
5. Ensure there are no **Alerts** for the cluster.

6. Click the **OpenShift web console** blue button on the top right corner of the screen.

7. Expand **Workloads** (1) and click **ConfigMaps** (2).

8. Search for **access** (1) in the search area. Click the **icp4deploy-cp4ba-access-info** (2) file.

9. Scroll down to the **bastudio-access-info** section. This section contains your login information for Cloud Pak for Business Automation. Create a browser bookmark for the Cloud Pak for Business Automation using the **Cloudpak Dashboard URL** (1). Go to the other **three URLs and accept the self-signed certificates** (2). Keep a copy of the **username** and **password** (3) to log in to the Cloud Pak Dashboard.


10. Scroll down to the **gitea-access-info** section. Copy and save these credentials, which you will use later during Automation Decision Services (ADS) setup.


11. Connect to your gitea environment using the URL and credentials provided. Click through the privacy messages and click **Sign In**.

12. Enter the same **Username** and **Password** (1) provided in the **gitea-access-info** file and click **Sign in** (2).

13. Click **+** to create the git repository.

14. Name the repository **SkyTalk_customer_retention** (1). Click **Create Repository** (2).
Ensure there are no spaces in the name.

15. Keep a copy of the repository URL, which is required later to configure ADS.


**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Create and set up a Watson Studio account
The Watson Machine Learning (WML) free account uses a charge unit called CUHs (Capacity Unit Hours) and provides 20 free CUHs per month. In general, each hour your models are deployed uses two CUHs. Once models are deployed, the CUHs are consumed at this rate until the models are undeployed. Therefore, you MUST UNDEPLOY the models in a timely manner. Assuming you undeploy the model after each demo, the free account will enable you to run a one-hour demo seven times in a month.

See the INSTRUCTIONS FOR UNDEPLOYING THE MACHINE LEARNING SERVICE section below.
1. Go to IBM Cloud.

2. Enter your **IBM ID**. If you do not have one, create a new one.

3. Ensure you are in your own Cloud Pak for Data account instance (1). Click **Create resource** (2).

4. Type **Watson** (1) in the search field and select **Watson Studio** (2).

5. Click the **Lite** plan (1). Select any **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

6. Return to **IBM Cloud**.

7. Click **Create resource**.


8. Type **Machine** (1) and select **Machine Learning** (2).

9. Click the **Lite** plan (1). Select any **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

10. Return to **IBM Cloud**.

11. Click **Create resource**.

12. Type **Object** (1) and select **Object Storage** (2).

13. Click the **Lite** plan (1), and click **Create** (2).

14. Click the **top menu** (1) and then **Resource list** (2).

15. Click **Services and software** (1) and click **Watson-Studio-xx** (2).

16. Click **Launch in IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.

17. Click **New deployment space**.

18. Name the production space **“SkyTalk production space”** (1). Set Cloud the storage service to **Cloud Object Storage-xx** (2). Select your newly created machine learning services, called **Machine Learning-xx** (3). Click **Create** (4).


19. Click **Close**.


20. Click **IBM Cloud Pak for Data** at the top left-hand side of the page to return to the home page.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Create and deploy two machine learning models
At this stage, the Watson Studio environment is completely set up. The three services (Watson Studio, ML, and Storage) are ready, and the deployment environment is set up. Now let’s create the two prediction services using AutoAI in Watson Studio.
Ensure you have downloaded these two data files prior to starting this step.

SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv
SkyTalk customer value data.csv

1. Click **New project** from the Watson Studio home page.

2. Select **Create an empty project**.

3. Name the project **SkyTalk customer retention** (1) and click **Create** (2).


4. Click **Assets**.


5. Click **New asset**.

6. Select **AutoAI**.

7. Name the AutoAI experiment **SkyTalk churn prediction** (1) and click **Associate a Machine Learning service instance** (2).

8. Select the **Machine learning** instance provisioned in the previous step (1). Click **Associate service** (2) in the blue ribbon.

9. Click **Reload**.

10. Click **Create**.

11. Click **Browse**.

12. Select the **SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv** file (1) and click **Open** (2).

13. Select **No** in the **Create a time series forecast?** field.

14. Select **Churn** in the **What do you want to predict?** field.

15. Click **Run experiment**.

16. Watson Studio will create 8 pipelines, which take approximately 2 minutes. An **Experiment completed** message (1) will display when the pipeline creation is finished. On the pipeline leaderboard, find the pipeline with a star icon (2) and save it as a model clicking **Save as** (3).

17. Select **Model** (1) and click **Create** (2).

18. A confirmation message appears, indicating the model was saved successfully (1). Return to the project view by clicking **SkyTalk customer retention** (2) in the breadcrumb navigation.

19. Create another AutoAI Experiment for the Customer lifetime value prediction. Click **New asset**.

20. Select **AutoAI**.

21. Name the AutoAI experiment **SkyTalk lifetime value prediction** (1) and click **Create** (2).
When you created the SkyTalk Churn value prediction you already defined the configuration. The Watson Machine Learning Service Instance is automatically populated.

22. Click **Browse**.

23. Select the **SkyTalk customer value data.csv** (1) file and then click **Open** (2).

24. When prompted **Create a time series forecast?**, click **No**.

25. Select **LifetimeValue** in the **What do you want to predict?** field.

26. Click **Run experiment**.

27. Watson Studio will create 8 pipelines, which take approximately 2 minutes. An **Experiment completed** message (1) will display when the pipeline creation is finished. On the pipeline leaderboard, find the pipeline with a star icon (2) and save it as a model clicking **Save as** (3).

28. Select **Model** (1) and click **Create** (2).

29. A confirmation message appears, indicating the model was saved successfully (1). Return to the project view by clicking **SkyTalk customer retention** (2) in the breadcrumb navigation.

30. Now there are two models ready to be promoted to the deployment space.

31. Hover the mouse over the **lifetime value prediction** model. Click on the three dots on the right-hand side and click **Promote to space**.

32. Choose the **SkyTalk production space** (1) as the target space and click **Promote** (2).

33. Promote the **SkyTalk churn prediction model** by repeating steps 31 - 32.

34. Click **IBM Cloud Pak for Data** to return to the home page.

35. Now you will deploy the models. Click **SkyTalk production space** in the Deployments section.
As a reminder, anytime your ML services are deployed your ML Lite subscription quota is consumed.

36. Select the **Assets** tab.

37. Select the top row and hover the cursor over the right side of the row until a rocket icon appears. Click the icon to **Deploy** the **SkyTalk churn prediction**.

38. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **churn** (2), and click **Create** (3).

39. Select the second row and hover the cursor over the right side of the row until a rocket icon appears. Click the icon to **Deploy** the **SkyTalk lifetime value prediction**.

40. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **Lifetime value** (2), and click **Create** (3).

41. Click the **Deployments** tab. Ensure the two services are deployed.

**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Get the credentials to set up the ML provider
This section explains how to get the credentials to set up the machine learning provider in ADS.
1. From the SkyTalk production space, select the **Deployments** tab (1) and click **churn** (2).

2. Copy the first portion of the **endpoint URL** path (the blue hightlighted section in the screenshot) and save it for the upcoming ML provider configuration.

3. Click **SkyTalk production space** in the breadcrumb navigation.

4. Select the **Manage** tab.

5. Copy the deployment **Space GUID** and save it for the upcoming ML provider configuration step.

6. Log out of **Watson Studio**.

7. Go to the **IBM Cloud environment** and log in using your personal credentials. Ensure you are in your Cloud Pak for Data instance (1).

Click the **Manage** (2) tab and select **Access (IAM)** (3).

8. Click **API keys** (1) and then click **Create an IBM Cloud API key** (2).

9. Name the key **MY_API_Key** (1) and click **Create** (2).

10. Copy and save the API key. Download the **API key file** and save it for the upcoming ML provider configuration step.

**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Open Automation Decision Services (ADS) and import the ADS demo project
Prior to performing this step, make sure you have downloaded the file: SkyTalk-customer-retention-DS_21.0.2_V12.zip. This file is required to set-up the ADS decision service.
1. Log in to your Cloud Pak for Business Automation instance. (Use the bookmark you created and the credentials you saved in step 9 of section **1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment**.)
If prompted for an authentication method, select Enterprise LDAP.
2. Expand the **top menu** (1) and click **Design** (2). Click **Business Automations** (3).

3. Pass through the privacy warning messages.

4. Under **Business automations**, click **Create** (1) and select **Decision automations** (2).

5. Name the automation **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (1) and click **Create**. (2)

6. Accept any privacy checks that may appear.

7. Close any guided tour views.

8. Click **Import**.

9. Select the SkyTalk-customer-retention-DS_21.0.2_V12.zip file and click **Open**.

10. Click **Import**.

11. Configure the ADS environment by clicking on the three dots to the right of the **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (1) and click **Settings** (2).

12. In the **Remote Git repositories** tab, paste the git **Repository URL** (1) from step 1.15. Enter the git **username and password** (2) from the ROKS access file in step 1.10. Click **Connect** (3).
To perform the following steps, your two machine learning services must be deployed in the Watson Studio deployment environment.

13. Ensure the **Remote Git repository** status is **Connected**.

14. Click the **Machine learning providers** tab to configure the machine learning provider.

15. Click **New**.

16. Select the **Watson ML** (1) machine provider and name the ML provider **SkyTalk ML provider** (2). Enter the **API key** (3), **Space ID** (4), and **URL** (5) from step 4 and click **Test connection** (6).

17. If the connection is successful, click **Save**.

18. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

**[Go to top](#top)**
6 - Update the decision model with the deployed ML models
Before performing this step, make sure your 2 ML services are deployed as explained in step 3.35.
1. Click the **SkyTalk retention DS** tile.

2. Click the **Customer Churn** model on the models tab.

3. Click **Connect**.

4. Select **SkyTalk ML provider**.

5. Expand the **SkyTalk churn prediction model** (1), select the **churn** deployment (2), and click **Next** (3).

6. Click **Next**.

7. Click **Run** to test the invocation.

8. If the test succeeds, click **Next**.

9. Click **Generate from test output**.

10. Click **OK**.

11. Click **Apply**.

12. Return to the **SkyTalk retention DS** using the breadcrumb navigation.

13. Click **Customer lifetime value** and repeat operations 6.3 - 6.12, expanding and selecting the **Customer lifetime value ML** model. After you have connected the the **Customer lifetime value** model, proceed to the next step (step 6.14).

14. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (1) in the breadcrumb navigation and click the **Retention Offer** model (2).

15. Select the **Run** tab.

16. Select the **High value profile** test file (1) and click **Run** (2).

The **retention offer** should display (3). Click **Run** again if you get a timeout error the first time.

**[Go to top](#top)**
7 - Deploy the decision service
Make sure you deploy the Skytalk retention DS decision service and not the SkyTalk initial retention DS.
1. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

2. Select the **Share changes** tab.

3. Ensure all changes are selected (1) and click **Share** (2).

4. Click **Share** to push the updates to the Git repository.

5. Select the **View history** tab.

6. Click **Version +** in the most recent **Last shared** history.

7. Name this version **V1** (1) and click **Create** (2).

8. Click the **Deploy** tab.

9. Expand the last created version **(V1)** (1) and click **Deploy** (2) in the **SkyTalk retention DS** row.

10. Click **Deploy** to confirm.

11. Wait for the deployment to finish. Click **Business Automations** in the breadcrumb navigation.

12. **Click Decision** (1) then click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** (2).

13. Publish the version you just deployed by clicking on the three dots on the right hand side of the V1 row, then click **Publish**.

14. Click **Publish**.

15. Ensure the status is **Published**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
8 - Import the client application
Prior to performing this step, make sure you have downloaded the SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_V12.twx archive file. This file is required to set-up the ADS decision service.
1. Expand the **top menu** (1) and click **Design** (2). Click **Business applications** (3).

2. Click **Import**.

3. Click **Browse**.

4. Select the SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_V12.twx file and click **Open**.


5. Click **OK**.

6. After the import, hover the mouse over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

7. Click the **gear icon**.

8. Select the **Advanced view mode** (1) and click **Save** (2).

9. Refresh the page and ensure the Advanced, **Diagram** and **Variables**, menus are accessible.

**[Go to top](#top)**
9 - Reconnect the application to the decision service
This step must be performed anytime a new version of the SkyTalk_rentention_DS is deployed. Ensure only the latest deployed DS is published to prevent Data renaming issues when reimporting the new service.
1. Click the **Diagram** tab.

2. Click the **SkyTalk_rentention_ds** node (1), then click the **Implementation** tab (2).

3. Click **New...**

4. Select **skytalk_retention_ds**.

5. Click **Add**.

6. Click **x** to close the view that appears.

7. Make sure operation is set to **retentionOffer** (1). Then select the **Data Mapping** tab (2).

8. Ensure there are no errors in the **data mapping section** (1). Click the **Preview** (2) to test the application.

9. Accept the security checks and enlarge the panel to see the entire view.

10. Enter **Peter Carter** (1) and click **Search** (2).

11. Click **Get offer**.

12. The offer displays.

The demo is ready.

When you are not practicing or delivering the demo, it is imperative that you reset the demo and save your ML quota in Watson Studio by following the steps in the AFTER EACH DEMO section below. Otherwise, your quota will be consumed quickly, which could prevent you from delivering any new demos until the end of the month.
**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO**
Open these resources before starting the demonstration
1. Log in to **Cloud Pak for Business Automation**. Use the bookmark and credentials saved during environment initialization. (See step 13 of *section 1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment*.)
2. Open the **top menu** (1), select the arrow in the **Design** row, (2), and click **Business applications** (3).

3. Hover the mouse over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

4. Click the **Preview** to open the application.


5. The **SkyTalk call center Application** opens.


**2 - IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation**
1. Return to the Cloud Pak for Business Automation home page.

Open the **top menu** (1) and select **Home** (2).


2. The **Cloud Pak for Business Automation** home page opens.


**3 - Watson Studio**
1. Go to the IBM Cloud environment and log in using your personal credentials. Ensure you are in your Cloud Pak for Data instance.
Click the resource list icon and then select **Watson Studio-xx** (2).


2. Click on **Launch** in **IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.


3. **Watson Studio** opens.


**4 - SkyTalk customer retention policy.pdf**
1. Click to open SkyTalk customer retention policy.pdf.

## **INSTRUCTIONS FOR UNDEPLOYING THE MACHINE LEARNING SERVICE** As a reminder, anytime your ML services are deployed your ML Lite subscription quota is consumed.
Undeploy the Watson Machine Learning service
At the end of the demonstration, undeploy the two ML services.
1. Undeploy the two ML services from the deployment space (select the **SkyTalk production space**).

2. Click the **Deployments** tab (1). In the **Lifetime value** row, click the three dots in the right-hand side and select **Delete** (2).

Click **Delete** again to confirm the deletion. Repeat step 2 to delete the deployment for the **churn prediction** row.
As soon as the two services are deleted, your ML Lite subscription quota is not consumed anymore.

3. Click **Watson Studio** to return to the Watson Studio home page.

4. Click the **SkyTalk customer retention** project.

5. Click the **Assets** tab.

6. Click the three dots on the right-hand side of the **Churn prediction 2** AutoAI experiment.

7. Click **Remove**.

8. Click **Remove** again to confirm the removal.

9. Go to the **Cloud Pak for Automation** browser tab you previously opened. Click **Skywalk customer retention DS**.

10. Click **Open**.

11. Select the **SkyTalk initial retention DS** tile.

12. Click **Retention offer**.

13. Hover the mouse over the purple **Customer Churn** rounded box.

14. Click the trash icon to remove the node.

15. Click **SkyTalk initial retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

16. Click on the trash can icon that appears when you move your cursor to the right-hand side of the **Customer Churn** predictive model row.

**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARATION REQUIRED TO GIVE THIS DEMO AGAIN**
1 - Redeploy both ML models in Watson Studio
1. Go to the **IBM Cloud environment** and log in using your personal credentials. Ensure you are in your **Cloud Pak for Data instance**.
2. Enter your **IBM ID**. If you do not have one, create a new one.
3. Click the **top menu** (1) and then **Resource list** (2).


4. Click **Watson Studio-XX** in the **Software and services** section.


5. Click **Launch in IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.


6. From the Watson Studio environment, select the **SkyTalk production space** deployment.


7. Select the **Assets** tab.


8. Hover your cursor over the right hand side of the **Skytalk churn prediction** row. Click the **rocket icon** that displays and then click **Deploy**.


9. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **churn** (2), and click **Create** (3).


10. Hover your cursor over the right hand side of the **Skytalk lifetime value prediction** row. Click the **rocket icon** that displays and then click **Deploy**.


11. Select **Online** (1), name the deployment **Lifetime value** (2), and click **Create** (3).


12. Click the **Deployments** tab. Ensure the status column indicates the two services are deployed.


**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Reconnect both ML models to Automation Decision Services
1. Log in to **Cloud Pak for Business Automation**. Use the bookmark and credentials saved during environment initialization. (Refer to substep 13 of step **1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment** above.)
2. Click the Recent automation **Skytalk customer retention DS**.


3. Click **Open**.


4. Click on the **SkyTalk retention DS** tile.


5. On the **Models** tab, click the **Customer Churn** model.


6. Click **Edit Configuration**.


7. Expand the **SkyTalk churn prediction** model.


8. Select the **churn** deployment (1), and click **Next** (2).


9. Click **Next**.


10. Click **Run** to test the invocation.


11. If the test succeeds, click **Next**.


12. Click **Generate from test output**.


13. Click **OK**.


14. Click **Apply**.


15. Return to the **SkyTalk retention DS** using the breadcrumb navigation.


16. Click **Customer lifetime value** and then repeat previous operations 2 - 14, expanding and selecting the Customer lifetime value ML model.


**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Redeploy the decision service
1. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS** in the breadcrumb navigation.

2. Select the **Share changes** tab.

3. Click the box next to **Decision service name** (1) to select all. Click **Share** (2).

4. Click **Share** to push the updates to the Git repository.

5. Select the **View history** tab.

6. Refresh the page. Click **Version +** in the most recent shared history.

7. Click **Version +** in the row with the deployment you just created.

8. **Name** the new version (1). For example, if the last version on the deployment list is V2, then name this deployment V3. Click **Create** (2).

9. Click the **Deploy** tab.

10. Expand the last shared version. This is the version you just created and named.

11. Select **Deploy** in the SkyTalk retention DS row.

12. Click **Deploy** when prompted.

13. Wait for the deployment to finish. Click **Business Automations**.

14. Click **Publish**.

15. Ensure the **Status** appears as **Published**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Reconnect the decision services to the call center application
This step must be performed anytime a new version of the SkyTalk_rentention_DS is deployed. Make sure only the latest deployed DS is published to prevent Data renaming issues when reimporting the new service.
1. Log in to **Cloud Pak for Business Automation**. Use the bookmark and credentials saved during environment initialization. (See step 9 of *section 1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment*.)
2. Click to open the **top menu** next to **IBM Cloud Pak** (1). Select the arrow next to **Design** (2) to expand the section. Click **Business applications** (3).

3. Hover the cursor over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

4. Click the **Diagram** tab.

5. Click the **Call SkyTalk_rentention_ds** node (1). Click the **Implementation** tab (2).

6. Click **New...**

7. Select **skytalk_retention_ds**.

8. Click **Add**.

9. Click **X** to close the view that appears.

10. Make sure operation is set to **retentionOffer** (1). Select the **Data Mapping** tab (2).

11. Ensure there are no errors in the **data mapping section** (1). Click **Preview** (2) to test the application.

12. Accept the security checks and enlarge the panel to see the entire view.

13. Enter **Peter Carter** (1). Click **Search** (2).

14. Click **Get offer**.

15. Ensure the offer displays.
